data.title: Biography of Madeleine Stowe

data.text:
Date of Birth: 1958, August 18 Years: 62 years Nation of birth: United States of America Height: 5 feet 7 inches Name madeleine stowe birth name Madeleine Marie Stowe Mora Dad Robert Stowe Mother Mora Stowe Nationality American Place of birth / city Los Angeles California ethnicity White Profession Actor Net worth $15 million Salary $75,000 eye color Dark brown Hair color Dark brown body measurements 33-25-33 breast size 33 waist size 25 hip size 33 weight in kg 59 Married to brian benben Kids May Theodora BenBen Education University of Southern California Awards golden balloons Films Revenge, The Last of the Mohicans, 12 Monkeys, We Were Soldiers, tv show The Amazing Spider-Man, Revenge, 12 Monkeys, Soundtrack Brothers two

American actress Madeleine Stowe got her fame from movies like Revenge , Trespassing and Last of the Mohicans . The actress has done equally well in the TV series. Revenge and for which she was nominated for a Golden Globe. She also won a special Golden Globe for the film. Shortcuts .

Graduated from the University of Southern California

Madeleine Stowe was born as Madeleine Marie Stowe Mora on August 18, 1958, in Los Angeles, California, United States. She belongs to a mixed ethnicity and has the American nationality.

She is the eldest child of Mireya Mora Stowe (mother) and Robert Stowe (father). She was raised along with her two younger siblings in their California hometown.

He graduated from the University of Southern California.

Won a special award at the Golden Globes

Madeleine Stowe began her acting career on the Baretta series in 1978. The same year, she appeared in the Marvel comics adaptation of The Amazing Spider-Man . She began her career in a feature film. Gangster Wars in 1981.

The actress had the opportunity to work together with Kevin Costner and Anthony Quinn in the movie Revenge. For her role in the film, she was nominated for a Golden Globe Award for Best Performance by an Actress in a Television Series-Drama. However, she did win the first Golden Globe special of hers for the film. Shortcuts along with Andie MacDowell, Bruce Davison , and Jack Lemmon .
